intro: Elaeocarpus hartleyi, commonly known as the New Zealand holly, is a species of flowering plant in the family Elaeocarpaceae. It is native to New Zealand and is characterized by its evergreen leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces berries that are typically red or orange when ripe, which are an important food source for native birds. It thrives in a variety of forested environments and is often found in coastal and lowland regions. Elaeocarpus hartleyi plays a significant ecological role in its native habitat, supporting local biodiversity.
